definition: special fund/money allocated for a particular purpose
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: It is suggested that the government should make efforts to set aside an appropriate fund for the vegetable basket program.
sentences.chinese: 人们建议政府应该做出努力，为菜篮子工程拨出专款。

sentences.english: The compensation fund for the benefit of the forest ecology shall be used for no other than the said purposes.
sentences.chinese: 森林生态效益补偿基金必须专款专用，不得挪作他用。

sentences.english: Revenue from government-controlled funds was used exclusively for its intended purposes.
sentences.chinese: 政府性基金收入按规定专款专用。

sentences.english: Congress has appropriated money for building the highway.
sentences.chinese: 国会已拨下专款建那条公路。

sentences.english: After the scandal over misappropriated funds the chief accountant was asked to step down.
sentences.chinese: 由于滥用专款的丑闻，总会计师被迫辞职。

sentences.english: We don't need to protect journalism with public money or grants.
sentences.chinese: 我们不需要使用公款或专款来保护新闻业。

sentences.english: The  prophet  appropriately  appropriated the  fund for repairing  propeller.
sentences.chinese: 预言者恰当的为修理螺旋桨拨专款。

sentences.english: A Bank conducting a trust or securities business shall appropriate funds exclusively for such business operations.
sentences.chinese: 银行经营信讬及证券业务，应指拨营运资金专款经营。

sentences.english: We had to write a new aid formula, then fund it.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须草拟一份新的援助方案，然后再拨专款。

definition: to assign/to allocate/to transfer (money to an account)
to shift (funds)/to (legitimately) take funds set aside for one purpose in order to use them for another/to embezzle/to misappropriate
to fund/to put money into sth/to invest
